intro: Senecio triodon var. neuquensis, commonly known as the Neuquén senecio, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. This variant is distinguished by its unique morphological traits, making it a notable species within the Senecio genus.
